item.title: Welcoming Dan Stowell
item.description: At BuildBuddy, our mission is to bring the world's best developer tools to every company. In order to achieve this mission, we need to build a team that has experience leading and scaling the fastest growing developer tools companies in the world. That's why we're so excited to share that Dan Stowell is joining BuildBuddy's engineering team.

item.title: Unusual Builds with Bytes
item.description: Fixing a download bug in Bazel Build without Bytes (BwoB)

item.title: Troubleshooting Bazel with Git Bisect
item.description: A guide to using Git bisect to troubleshoot Bazel issues

item.title: Welcoming Vanja Pejovic
item.description: At BuildBuddy, our mission is to bring the world's best developer tools to every company. A core part of that mission involves building systems and infrastructure that can handle the scale of the world's largest enterprises. That's why we're so excited to share that Vanja Pejovic is joining BuildBuddy's engineering team.

item.title: Welcoming Fabian Meumertzheim
item.description: At BuildBuddy, our mission is to bring the world's best developer tools to every company. A core part of that mission involves building around the open source Bazel ecosystem to give every engineer fast, reproducible, and correct builds.

item.title: Why is my Bazel build so slow?
item.description: The promise of Bazel is the promise of fast builds. So what do you do if your build was slow? Curse out the developer that convinced your company to migrate to Bazel? Of course not! You’d never do that, right? 🙂

item.title: How to migrate an iOS app to Bazel
item.description: Wondering how to migrate your Apple-based project to Bazel? Whether it's iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, or visionOS, this guide is for you.

item.title: How Bazel 7.0 Makes Your Builds Faster
item.description: Highlighting changes in Bazel 7.0 that help BuildBuddy users build even faster!

item.title: What's New in Bazel 7.0
item.description: You know the drill 😁; We reviewed over 3,700 commits and summarized them, so you don't have to!

item.title: Lazily Pulling Container Images with Podman and SOCI Snapshotter
item.description: We’re excited to share how we're making "podman pull" ten times faster by lazily fetching container images using the SOCI Snapshotter.

item.title: Bazelcon 2023 Recap
item.description: Another year, another Bazelcon! This year's edition was held in Munich, Germany, and featured two days of talks by Bazel maintainers, contributers, and users. Among the Bazel users represented as this year's conference were: Booking.com, RabbitMQ, Spotify, Stripe, Uber, and more.

item.title: BuildBuddy Named to Inaugural Redpoint InfraRed 100
item.description: New York City – July 18, 2023 – BuildBuddy, which provides an enterprise software for the Bazel ecosystem, announces its inclusion in the first edition of the Redpoint InfraRed 100, a comprehensive list of the next 100 promising private companies in Cloud Infrastructure. This curated selection of companies represents the next generation of leaders in the industry, poised to make a significant impact in the cloud infrastructure market.

item.title: PostgreSQL Support for BuildBuddy
item.description: We're happy to announce PostgreSQL support for BuildBuddy.

item.title: Providing Control Over Cache Encryption
item.description: We are announcing a feature that allows customers to control how their data is encrypted in in our cache.

item.title: Buck2 Unboxing
item.description: A review of Meta's new build tool Buck2.

item.title: Keyboard Shortcuts in BuildBuddy
item.description: We're happy to announce keyboard shortcuts in BuildBuddy.

item.title: Welcoming Grace Chuang
item.description: To fulfill our mission of bringing the world's best developer tools to every company, keeping our business running smoothly is as important as ensuring our customers' builds run smoothly. That's why we're excited to share that Grace Chuang is joining BuildBuddy!

item.title: Donating rules_xcodeproj to the Mobile Native Foundation
item.description: We are solidifying the community ownership of rules_xcodeproj by donating it to the Mobile Native Foundation.

item.title: Multiple Xcode Configurations with rules_xcodeproj 1.3
item.description: The one where we added a much requested, but surprisingly difficult to implement, feature.

item.title: Introducing rules_xcodeproj 1.0
item.description: How we got here and what’s next.
